Html:
I read the threads about GeoServer and Gmap.net but they are not conclusive. I don't know if it worked and how it might work. I'm trying to run Gmap without online connection. I don't what to use the prefetch feature because I don't know where the user will be looking at and I would think it is not practical to prefetch the whole world , correct ?

Radioman suggested a copy/paste for one of the providers and change the server URL to GeorServer URL. I downloaded the GeorServer and it came preloaded with some maps . Now I need to run a test to see if I can use it . what is my URL at this point ?

looking at 
string MakeTileImageUrl(GPoint pos, int zoom, string language)
      {
         char letter = ServerLetters[GetServerNum(pos, 3)];
         return string.Format(UrlFormat, letter, zoom, pos.X, pos.Y);
      }
and 
static readonly string UrlFormat = "http://{0}.tile.openstreetmap.org/{1}/{2}/{3}.png";
I know that this URL is for Open Street Map. what would be my GeeoServer URL ? Does it have to point to a specific shape file , layer , tiles ? Is it possible to add this as a feature in future releases giving the fact that a lot of people requested this feature and it will make Gmap even dramatically more superior than DotSpatial or EasyGIS, ..etc

Thank you

dunno, i have never tried it

p.s. check http://docs.geoserver.org/stable/en/user/installation/windows/installer.html
